All Reviews

  1. I couldn't be more pleased with this stand. It looks great next to my sink and is a perfect complement to my high end shave brush and DE razor. Very pleased!
  2. I have received this stand in perfect condition (new) from Perella. It fits all sorts of razors, including battery powered ones. It also accommodates to most brushes.
  3. I recently ordered this razor and shaving brush stand and I am very pleased with my purchase. The stand is very solid, sturdy and looks great in my bathroom. My razor and new shaving brush fit perfectly on it. I highly recommend this to anyone who uses a shaving brush and &#34;old timey&#34; shave soap. Well worth the price. The packaging in which it arrived was also very sturdy and professional looking. Great value!!
  4. I have a few stands, I have brushes ranging from 20-28 knots and a few razors of different lengths and weights. I want the stand to be balanced, I want my brush or razor not to fall off the stand if bumped. I want the stand to be easy to clean and look good on my bathroom counter. I enjoy the quite time of grooming with my favorite music, the Escali stand is an excellent choice for my shaving equipment.
  5. great design and made to last a lifetime. love it
  6. This is just the right kind of stand for the newer Gillette battery powered razors. It has a wider shaft and wouldn't fit my old stand. The design is masculine and balance - no tipping - is solid.
  7. I bought this for my brother, who wanted a simple, classic shaving stand. He absolutely loves it!
  8. This is a great razor and brush stand, looks superb and well made. The base is slightly heavy so it balances well, and is padded for the premium feel. The chrome finish looks great and I think it looks better than a lot of expensive stands out there. I currently need to buy a brush so can't comment on how it would fit. I am using Gillette Sensor Excel and fits perfectly on the stand.
  9. This stand is perfect for my new razor and brush. It's much nicer than I thought it would be, and, in fact, I ordered a second stand today to use with one of my other razor/brush sets. You can't go wrong with this-it's a nice heavy stand with excellent chrome plating and appears to be very durable. Highly recommended!
  10. Good brush stand, however the yoke for the brush does not accomodate larger diameter brushes. I solve this problem by simple resting the brush &#34;slanted&#34; on the yoke with handle leaning toward center support. Stand is made very well, strong and sturdy.
  11. Great stand I own a Merkur Long Handle 23c(180) has plenty of room under it so it doesn't touch the base. As for the picture I took it on an angle it doesn't tilt.
  12. It's a great stand! Seems very well made at a most reasonable price. I am very happy with it! The base is sufficiently heavy so as to avoid easily tipping over despite my use of a razor and brush well on the heavier side of things. If you want a stand, you will not be disappointed.
  13. straightforward quality built. It is exactly what it looks like. I like the knurled portion in the middle since it matches my razor.
  14. I've been using this stand for a couple weeks and so far it seems like a very sturdy and quality product.   15. Solid. Holds the razor well. Holds the brush well. Solid piece.
  16. Sturdy little stand that fits my Escali brush and Edwin Jagger DE89 razor perfectly.<br />Nice chrome finish looks like it will hold up well and the heavy base keeps it all upright.
  17. This stand is well made and well balanced. It has already made a difference in keeping my blades dry and clean. Recommended.
  18. A substantial stand that's well crafted and seems like it will last for years. Fits my parker brush and futur razor perfectly.
  19. Works perfect for my long handle Merkur, very happy thus far for the price!
  20. First point of note: this, the Colonel Conk, and a half-dozen others like this are all the same model. There's no point paying more for one than another other. The finish is a nice chrome. Doesn't seem to scratch easily. Looks nice on the counter, fairly classy with a Merkur razor and Escali brush. Nothing falls out. No complaints about usability. The problem, though, is that the bottom is a stick-on piece of foam that compresses after a week or two. That brings the metal base level with the counter. If you splash water anywhere near it, the base will begin to rust. The solution is to pull off and discard the foam, exposing a lead (?) disk that weights the base. Then you stick a couple of rubber bumpers (the kind you'd attach to the inside of cabinet doors) to the disk to elevate the assembly a few millimeters higher. (I also drilled a hole in a larger fabric bumper and mounted it above the disk to push the disk down.) The short elevation actually makes the thing look better. Hasn't rusted at all in two months.
  21. This was a gift. It works well to hold razor and brush. It is easy to clean. It is a way to make the chore of shaving more enjoyable, handier and more pleasing to eye.
  22. The quality of the stand is good but I bought it with idea to use for the brush and for the razor but the razor Gillette Fusion Power Proglide razor does not feet into the stand slot. That's why I give 3 stars rating to the stand.
  23. Great stand, high quality, and durable. Exactly what I was looking for!
  24. Nice product and very nicely fit for purpose combined with a timely delivery. I have no hesitation in recommending this product.
  25. Exactly as described. High quality, no sign of corrosion after several months.<br /><br />I wish my tap water wasn't so hard - the chrome finish shows all of the mineral stains and requires frequent cleaning. Not the product's problem, shiny and bright when it's kept up.
  26. Shipped quickly, solid product. Does exactly what it should and looks great doing it!
  27. The Escali Deluxe Chrome Razor and Brush Stand does the trick! It makes my straight razor easy to grab and my brush upside down, which is crucial for drying. Plus, it looks great. One slight issue, however, was my brush didn't fit at first. But I widened it slightly with some pliers and it now fits perfect. Easy fix.
  28. Shipped quickly, easy to assemble, looks great. Well done.
  29. nice heavy base, nice finish
  30. Solid product, performs as advertised. The razor hanger side could use more depth. Just barely fits my Merkur long handled razor. If I'm not careful in placing it precisely the razor falls of when I put the brush on.

  32. Holds razor and brush very nicely. Looks great. Very stable.

I can't speak to its durability, other than that it feels well-made.<br /><br />If you're looking for a stand and can be sure that your brush and razor will fit, this is a good option.
  43. It has a heavy solid base. It is well made and I would recommend.
  44. This is a really great looking, shiny stand. It doesn't look cheap at all. The only issue I had was that the stand wouldn't hold the Parker silvertip brush I purchased by its handle as it was about a 1/16th of an inch too small. You could however hold it by the brushes knot which works pretty well, but causes the brush to tip over. I got tired of the balancing act, and I was able to spread the holders out enough to comfortably hold the brush without damaging the stand. I am not recommending you try this, but it did work for me. I had a hair brush that had a slightly oval handle that would slide into the holder on its skinny side but not the larger side. I put the handle between the brush holder on the skinny side of the brush and turned the brush basically forcing the stand holder &#34;tines&#34; outward about 1/8th of an inch. This game me just enough room and you can't even tell that the tines were bent. If you try this, know that you may damage the stand and void any warranty.
  45. Product was just as described. Is great quality with good weight so won't tip over. Looks very nice on counter. Highly recommend.
  46. The product works - holds my brush and razor well. It nice bright and clean chrome finish, and is sturdily made.
  47. It fits my Merkur Model 180 and the Excali Badger Brush, which was my biggest concern in ordering. It's like they were made to go together. the bottom has a neoprene pad so it's non-stick and fine around water. The build is solid, not cheap or flimsy. Looks really nice (see picture), and it just works. I'll post again in a few months about the durability, but for now, I'm very pleased with the purchase.
  48. What can you really say about a shaving brush stand? It's well made, it looks good, it does what it is supposed to. I use an old Gillette double edge razor and the stand holds that well also and would probably work with pretty much any razor. This would make a nice gift for anybody who shaves with the old school shaving brush, regardless of the razor they use. I think this is an excellent product at an excellent price.   178. A simple item, but to paraphrase an old saying, the devil could be in the details. In this case the devil is missing entirely because the details have all been accomplished flawlessly. The finish is high quality, the base is weighted so that the stand has the stability that you would expect. Also note that the shaft is knurled for a sure grip and the base has a non-slip rubber-like pad to prevent slippage. My only cautionary note is that some shaving brush handles may be too wide for this (or for most shaving brush stands). The part of your shaving brush that you will use to hang from this stand should be narrower than 1&#34;. This limitation is relatively standard for shaving brush stands so if your brush is thicker, you likely will need to pass on using a stand to dry your brush. Overall, I highly recommend this stand and I would buy it again or give it to a friend without reservation.

I would just shake the water out my brush after I finished shaving and set it down on the counter with the tips up to dry. The the brush would rot out in a couple of months and all the bristles would fall out and I would eventually just buy another in disgust at how low manufacturing standards had fallen and how our grandparents wouldn't have stood for this kind of crap, blah blah blah you get the picture.<br /><br />Then one day as I was buying my umpteenth brush I read a review on Amazon where a guy was saying that your stuff will rot if you don't have one of these brush stands and well let's just say I felt really dumb. As in I wasted a couple a hundred bucks in order to &#34;save&#34; 30 dumb.<br /><br />I've had the same brush for a year now (a 12 dollar tweezerman) which has lost NO bristles, yet.

Heavy enough to stand firm and not wobble on the counter as I take the bush or razor on and off. A bargain for the price, especially when you look at the stands pushed by AoS.<br /><br />My only complaint is that I wish the small tongs used to hold the razor were just a few mm longer, because if I'm not careful and set my razor too quickly, the edge of the DE razor can overhang the edge of the tong and the whole thing slips out of square - risking dropping the razor.

The majority of the weight is where it should be at the bottom of the stand and contains a felt piece at the bottom so to not cause damage to the surface it sits on. I can safely remove the blade or brush and leave one on their with out fear of the stand moving. Happily surprised and I can see the stand going the long distance through the years.

I even threw it in my toiletries bag over Christmas, and it bounced its way through the trip without showing any sign of damage.<br /><br />Shiny - It is chrome, so it matches a chrome-handled Razor well. It's not art, but as a utilitarian piece, it's not going to attract any negative attention while it stands on the vanity top. You will have to keep it clean because drying water is likely to leave spots, but there isn't much work required in that.<br /><br />Well Weighted - It is sturdy enough to hold one or both pieces its designed for. I've never had it tip, and I don't have much concern of knocking it over even if it sits near the edge of the surface. That said, bear in mind the price - you're not going to get anything miraculous, especially at this price point - but know that you don't have to spend more to have confidence in your stand.<br /><br />Bonus! - The bottom of the base is covered in a nice finish that makes me think it's soft enough to not scratch quality vanities (I can't be sure, because I certainly don't have a great one!) but it doesn't seem porous enough that I'm worried about water soaking in and eroding the base. Only time will tell how it holds up, but it seems great!

  547. After 5 years using an electric razor, and more than 30 years using multi-edged blades that cost so much, I decided to go back to the double edge safety razors of my youth. A month ago I bought an Escali Deluxe Chrome Razor and Brush Stand, to go with a new Edwin Jagger razor (De89lbl Double Edge Safey Razor Chrome Plated Lined Detail, $34.00), Escali 100% Pure Badger Shaving Brush ($12.95), Proraso Shaving Soap, and a Cassani Fogless Shower Mirror. So far, they have all been worth 5 stars. The Edwin Jagger razor feels solid, but not heavy, and fits comfortably in my slightly above average size hands (I wear size XL dishwashing gloves, and can squeeze into size L when necessary). The Escali Razor and Brush Stand holds the Jagger razor and Escali Badger shaving brush securely, and the unit is well-balanced, with a base heavy enough to be very stable as it sits on the edge of a soap shelf in the shower. The Badger Shaving Brush easily works up a good lather with a very small amount of Proraso Shaving Soap (just a brief swill of the wet brush in the soap tub is more than sufficient). The Cassani mirror is truly fogless, as promised, and hangs lightly from the Cassani hook which I have attached beneath my shower head. (There is also a hook to hold a razor, which I use to support the Jagger razor as necessary while I'm shaving, before returning it so hand in the Escali Razor and Brush Stand. All in all, I am very pleased with all of the purchases. I also purchased 3 different blades - Wilkinson Sword Classic, Derby Extra ,and Feather Razor. Two weeks with the Wilkinson was more than enough. Actually, after 2 days my daughter asked if I had a rash on the lower part of my neck, so I went back to using an electric razor on my neck until I finished with the Wilkinson. I thought I might be reacting to the Proraso Shaving Soap, but I had no problem using Proraso with the Derby Blade. The Derby Blade has been great, and after nearly 3 weeks with 1 blade, I am shaving with less nicks and more comfort than I did with the Wilkinson at any time. The Feather Razor blades have not yet arrived, apparently having to ship from Hong Kong, or somewhere in the far east.
  548. Just right. Very nice-looking, solid, weighted stand. Worth the price; should keep for years. Fits Tweezerman shaving brush and probably most, if not all, double-edged razors.

I took mine to the garage, wrapped the brush end in a cloth, and with a hammer taped the prongs out a little bit. My brush ([[ASIN:B00B1TKY8C B00B1TKY8C]] now fits on the stand hanging by the base as I only needed 1mm or so extra width. Definitely recommended.

It would be better if the opening was larger to accommodate different brush widths. You are not able to spread the tines of the &#34;fork&#34; so this product has a limited use. I have since purchased another stand where the tine is &#34;spreadable&#34; which accommodates all of my different brush sizes.

I don't blame the manufacturer or seller, as it is exactly as advertised. I am using a cheap Omega &#34;48&#34;, and neither the handle, nor base of the brush fit in the holder. But don't despair! There's a workaround: Just rest the brush horizontally on the forked holder, and all is good with this little gem of a shaving stand!

It's heavy enough so that it won't knock down too easily, It's very attractive looking, the knurling on the vertical post is well executed, the base and hanger tabs nicely mirror plated. It holds my Merkur 180 and Escali brush perfectly. Should last a lifetime. What more can one say, it's just a stand--but for under $20 you can't go wrong with this one.
  1029. Product arrived on time and as described. It was very nice relative to the price i paid. I am very happy with it. It holds my razor and brush well. Even my wife commented that it looked nice on the counter! I would recommend to friends and family.
  1030. I was looking for a decent quality, inexpensive razer/brush stand and I found it with this product. It's built well and looks great! I would definitely recommend!

  1045. As compared to other similar brush and razor stands. The finish is flawless and the construction is very solid. I have an Merkur HD34C, Gillette Heavy SS Red Tip, and a Muhle R41 and all three fit the stand perfectly (not at the same time). The Gillette and the HD both have a pretty bulky handle and it poses no issue. The brush holder also does it's job wonderfully. The base has a good amount of heft to it, thus far after a month of use, I've had absolutely no stability issues.<br /><br />The only thing I might gripe about is the fact that the pad on the bottom of the stand appears to be foam rubber. My counter gets wet while I'm shaving, and the stand sits on the counter, rather than a shelf. The pad on the bottom, when wet, is a bit slippery. It's not an issue really. It dries quickly and easily, and once it dries, it's back to it's normal grippy self. But when wet, you could probably slide it down the counter like a frosty beer mug down a long bar top.<br /><br />On the flip side of that coin, I don't know what other material wouldn't have the same issue. Say cork for instance may be just as slippery when wet, I have no idea. Overall, you can't beat this for the price asked. You can pay double or more for the exact same look from another brand. It doesn't take much shopping around to see that.
  1046. Good looking and great performing. Glad my brush can dry like it's supposed to! Would recommend to anyone! Thank you!
  1047. I wanted a chrome (not brushed nickel) stand for a vintage double-edged razor and badger brush. In addition, it's really solidly built and has a non-slip base. Good stuff.

  1229. I bought this item as part of a fund raiser raffle for the hospital at which I work. When I received it, I was very happy with its appearance and with its weight, balance, and stability.   1230. The price of shaving has gotten ridiculous, so I looked into the alternatives. I'm the kind of guy who will go miles out of my way, just to keep moving rather than stew in bumper to bumper traffic. A few months ago I took the plunge back in time. I learned on the safety razor, so had no particular fear of it. Did some due diligence and bought a German safety razor, shaving cream in a tube, a styptic pencil, a hundred blades that last me about 2 weeks at a cost around 20 cents each, a badger brush and this stand. My total investment was about $80. The safety razor is not the rickety trap door type and I don't foresee needing replacement ever. Not sure how long I can expect the $10 brush to last, but if I live long enough, I believe the savings in blades will show a profit over \\"modern\\" shaving. Not a significant amount, that's why I mentioned the driving the extra miles to at least not hating the drive. The satisfaction is a little like if I had found a way to extend one gallon of gas into 3 and drive a larger, better car for less in the long run than my little 4 cylinder. The shave is better by far. Expect a few scrapes early on, but it gets better in time.<br /><br />Oh, the stand. It is a lovely, I mean masculine, addition to my vanity. Well weighted, with the substantial razor and the brush on I have not come close to knocking it over. The prongs are bent upward slightly to keep from too easily knocking the razor and brush off accidently. It can still be done, but has not quite happened to me yet. It needs to be wiped dry almost every use to keep it looking sexy because water gets on it and will leave water marks, easily removed from the highly polished finish. I suspect it will also prevent corrosion, I suspect. It's not quite \\"universal\\". I enjoyed my experience so much that I purchased a shaving \\"set\\" as a gift that included this stand. The brush that came with it was a marble handled one that was just a millimeter or two wide, so the brush had to be forced into the stand with 2 hands. With a hammer, I was able to spread the prongs enough to slip in easily.

  1375. I've had this thing for a month and it reminds me of chrome plated brass fixtures from houses built 100 years ago. I was just prompted for a review and so I took it apart. Inside the base is a cast iron weight with a high quality foam pad glued to the bottom. Over that goes a stamped (probably chrome plated brass) metal cover that is thickly chrome plated completely inside and out. Even the inside you would never normally see is plated. There is a 1\\" piece of all-thread that screws into the cast iron base, through the stamped metal cover into the upright shaft. There is another 1\\" piece of all-thread which screws into the top of the shaft, through the flange that holds the razor and brush, and into a acorn nut--the top of the unit.<br /><br />It's made just like you would think, just like it would have been 100 years ago and for the most part out of quality materials that would have been used 100 years ago. I've tested all pieces with a magnet and the only parts that are not non-metallic are the cast iron base weight (which is necessary and a good design feature) and the two short pieces of all-thread that fit into either end of the shaft to hold it all together--not a good design feature. They appear to be plated to look like brass, but they are definitely magnetic. I would think it would be easy to make this product with brass all-thread, but I still give it 5 stars. With some spit and polish, this product will have value in 50 or 100 years. This is not Wal-Mart/3rd World crap.
  1376. I purchased the merkur model 180 (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000NL0T1G/ref=oh_details_o05_s01_i01?ie=UTF8&psc=1) and found that the detail on the metal matches the detail on the razor, so that was an added plus! Does it's job well, and looks good while doing so. Would buy again!
  1377. love it. It fits the brush I have which is medium size as well as the Edwin Jagger razor. nice look and clean look.
  1378. This stand fits my Merkur 180 and Escali brush perfectly. It feels like it's solidly built, and I expect it to last a good while.
  1379. The chrome finish & texture is a perfect match for my Merkur Heavy Duty #34C razor & is the perfect size & compliment for my Escali badger hair brush. Stunning looks & built to last.
  1380. The stand has no rust or pits and retains shine with just a quick swipe of dry cloth. Would recommend this and would buy it again but I don't think it will wear out.

  1778. I looked perhaps ridiculously too long for the &#34;just right&#34; stand...and this one is, just right. It's made with good quality at a reasonable price. For those who were initially wondering about the base and rubber pad being released too much, I have some information. I took mine apart to give it a wax job and noticed that there is a washer placed between the chrome base and weight. The pad is actually stuck to that weight so...what the effect of the washer is, it raises the height of the chrome base up just a small amount so that the skirt of the base won't come in contact with your countertop. I think this may have been an &#34;add-on&#34; at some point in the assembly chain to address that problem.<br />The arms are perfect and hold my Merkur and Escali brush perfectly.<br />The weight is just right; just heavy enough to avoid toppling.<br />The knurling gives just enough grip to avoid sliding and also masks fingerprints.

  1911. I chose a 5 star rating for this because of the price and finish. The Escali is exactly the same stand as the Col Conk Evernice stand except for the finish. I paid $29.59 for the Conk and $21.95 for the Escali (savings for a 100 pack of Derby DE razors, huh?). The Escali has a polished chrome finish that matches my Merkur DE Razor and is sturdy just as the Conk stand is.
  1912. Perfect. Exactly as described and solid.
  1913. Looks great! Nice heavy base to keep the stand balanced well.
  1914. Great stand. I have really liked it a lot, and it has helped my badger brush stay fresh. The brush holder was a little tight on my brush, but it works. The seller was also wonderful.
  1915. Nice razor stand. Looks good on the vanity .
  1916. This works well, and looks great on the counter.
  1917. Looks nice and works.
  1918. JUST WHAT I WANTED AND RECEIVED IT VERY FAST! THE PRICE AND THE QUALITY WAS SUPER!
  1919. The order for the Escali razor and brush stand was processed and shipped promptly. It has a beautiful chrome finish and looks great on my sink top. The weight is perfect so it will not tip over and the rubber base is hidden and does not mark the counter top.
  1920. Bought this for my long handle merkur razor and tweezerman brush, fits perfectly! Feels nice and heavy, when you pull it out of the box you would swear you paid 50 bucks for it!
  1921. does exactly as described
  1922. A little expensive but I love seeing the quality of this device every day.
  1923. I went into Art of Shaving and they tried to sell me something very similar to this with a starting price of $100. The mustachioed salesman told me that their stands were so solid they wouldn't fall over during an earthquake. As a geologist, I found this notion offensive. Needless to say, the above stand will meet all of your brush and razor-holding needs just fine. It's utilitarian and doesn't get in the way. Everything I needed.
  1924. I am a bit disappointed with this unit. The stand Does Not do a very good job holding either the shave brush or my razor. The ends of the stand should be turned up a bit more to help hold the items on the stand better. As designed now both my razor and brush simply slide off the holder.<br />Sign...disappointed!!!
  1925. I am very satisfied with my Escali deluxe Razor and Brush stand. It looks great with my Mekur 180 razor.
  1926. Item delivered on time, was as described.
  1927. Great quality. Looks nice. Works great.
  1928. Nice and shiny. Just a holder so not much else to comment on until it gets older....
  1929. I just received my razor stand. First impression, I love it. It was heavier than I expected it to be, and sturdier. I own a 1971 Gillette razor and it fits perfectly. Not to mention how nice it looks too.
  1930. does what it is supposed to do
  1931. American made arrived on time. Quality products. Nuff said!!!!

  1933. Heavy base, easy to use. Looks good. Good price. Nothing more needed by me.

  1935. Very nice and practical stand. Sturdy, sits well on the bathroom counter. Holds the razor and brush well. Happy with my purchase.
  1936. Really nice sturdy organizer for your shaving equipment !!
  1937. Beautifully made razor/brush stand for the right price. Looks great and is of high quality. Would highly recommend purchasing!!
  1938. I am very happy with this purchase. This stand holds my Escali shaving brush and my shaving razors nicely.
  1939. This product is great for any safety razor shaving kit. I currently own the Parker 96R which sits ok on the stand. The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars is because the mount for the shaver could be a bit longer so it would sit more securely.
  1940. The stand is sturdy and looks great - and has a great price. Especially compared to the ridiculous high end stand that don't look or work any better. My only comment is that I wish it would be able to hold the Fusion razor with the razor side up. Otherwise a great buy.
  1941. It doesn't hold my razor very well. It's great for the shaving brush.
  1942. I cannot review how this product works since I bought it for my son who is discouraged with the price of blades. He will be 42 in October and has very sensitive skin. He has never shaved with a safety razor but has decided that the new razors are too expensive and not worth the price. When he said that he would like to try the razor his father used when he first started to shave, I jumped on the suggestion and did some research. This stand is part of a gift he will be getting in October on his birthday. The rest of the gift consists of a Merkel safety razor, a soap and soap dish, and a combination package of blades offered by Amazon.<br /><br />I can say the stand looks beautiful and should help eliminate clutter on his sink. Hopefully, he will be able to use this type of shaving system and not get a terrible rash on his face. As his mother, I am grateful that I was able to purchase all the components of an \\"old fashioned shave\\" on Amazon. I can say for certainty that the style of the stand looks elegant and will fit in with the decor of his WC.
  1943. Quality product. My Merkur long-handle DE razor fits the stand perfectly, as does my Escali shaving brush. Perfect size and weight! Recommended.
